JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG were represented by their Agent , Mr G. Kostanyan , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant ’s late husband had worked for ORG ( hereafter “ NORP ” ) , a company involved in manufacturing various machinery and equipment and whose majority shareholder is the State .

CARDINAL . No salary was paid to the staff for DATE , since PERSON was experiencing financial problems . In DATE the majority of PERSON ’s staff were ordered to take unpaid leave for an indefinite period .
CARDINAL . On DATE the relevant trade union instituted court proceedings against PERSON in the interests of the staff , seeking arrears for unpaid salary and other benefits .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the claim and ordered PERSON to pay a total of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL , including ORG ORG to the applicant ’s late husband . No appeal was lodged against this judgment which became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued the writ of execution ( կատարողական թերթ ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff instituted enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL . In the course of these proceedings the bailiff decided to freeze PERSON ’s property and bank accounts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to stay enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL on the ground that bankruptcy proceedings had been instituted in respect of PERSON . It appears , however , that the enforcement proceedings were resumed on DATE and that part of PERSON ’s frozen property was sold at a public auction . On DATE ORG decided to terminate the bankruptcy proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff once again decided to stay enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL , but later resumed them on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government adopted decree no . ORG , on the basis of which PERSON was allowed to sell its property . The proceeds of the sale were to be directed by the company towards paying off its debts in respect of the ORG budget .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff stayed the enforcement proceedings on the basis of this decree .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government adopted decree no . CARDINAL-A , according to which it decided to sell its shares in PERSON to a private company . The buyer in return undertook an obligation towards the State to make investments of various amounts , including creation of jobs .
CARDINAL . It appears that enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL remained stayed on the basis of this decree for DATE but were later resumed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s late husband was ordered to take unpaid leave .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date thereafter he instituted proceedings against PERSON , seeking unpaid salary for the period DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the claim and ordered PERSON to pay AMD CARDINAL to the applicant ’s late husband . No appeal was lodged against this judgment which became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued the writ of execution upon the request of the applicant ’s late husband .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s late husband submitted the writ of execution to the bailiff .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff instituted enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL on the basis of the above writ of execution .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s late husband requested the withdrawal of the writ of execution .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the bailiff decided to discontinue the enforcement proceedings ( ավարտել կատարողական վարույթը ) on the ground that the applicant ’s late husband had requested the withdrawal of the writ of execution .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband passed away .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant instituted proceedings against PERSON , claiming that the respondent owed her late husband ORG CARDINAL in unpaid salary and seeking to be awarded that amount .

CARDINAL . In her submissions made before ORG the applicant modified her claim , seeking a smaller amount , namely ORG CARDINAL , in view of the fact that a sum of money had already been awarded to her late husband by the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . A representative of PERSON who was present at the hearing did not object to the applicant ’s claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having examined the materials of the case , including the applicant ’s marriage certificate and the certificate concerning unpaid salary , found the applicant ’s claim to be substantiated and ordered PERSON to pay AMD CARDINAL to the applicant . No appeal was lodged against this judgment which became final .
CARDINAL . It appears that the applicant did not request ORG to issue a writ of execution in order to submit it to the bailiff for enforcement purposes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the application was communicated to the respondent Government .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government submitted their observations .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted her observations and just satisfaction claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government submitted their comments on the applicant ’s just satisfaction claims .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Government informed the ORG that on DATE the applicant had been recognised as her late husband ’s heir . The ORG submitted a copy of an inheritance certificate dated DATE which had been issued upon the applicant ’s application . The certificate was issued by the local notary in respect of the applicant and her CARDINAL children and mentioned as the estate the deceased ’s flat , as well as unpaid salary and other lump - sum payments owed to him by PERSON . The Government further stated that on DATE the applicant had filed a request with the bailiff , seeking to reopen enforcement proceedings no . CARDINAL , which had been granted . As a result , all CARDINAL judgments had been enforced and the applicant had received all the corresponding outstanding amounts .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant confirmed that the judgment debts had been paid to her on DATE .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic provisions see the judgment in the case of NORP v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , if a party to enforcement proceedings dies , the bailiff is obliged to replace him with a legal successor as determined by law , a court judgment or an agreement .
CARDINAL . According to LAW ( CARDINAL ) , the bailiff shall discontinue the enforcement proceedings if the creditor has requested the withdrawal of the writ of execution .

CARDINAL . According to LAW § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , the bailiff shall terminate the enforcement proceedings ( կարճել կատարողական վարույթը ) if the creditor waives his claim for recovery of the judgment award .

CARDINAL . According to LAW § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , the bailiff shall terminate the enforcement proceedings if the creditor or the debtor has died and the claims or the debts established by the judicial act may not be transferred to his legal successor .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that , if an employee dies , his outstanding salary and other similar payments shall be paid to a family member , provided that the latter submits the death certificate and other necessary documents certifying the family link within DATE after the date of the person ’s death .

CARDINAL . According to Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and DATE , the estate encompasses the property belonging to the testator on the date of opening the inheritance , including funds , securities and proprietary rights and obligations . The inheritance shall be opened on the date of a person ’s death . An heir accepts inheritance by submitting an application on accepting the inheritance or on receiving an inheritance certificate from the notary of the district where the inheritance was opened . Inheritance can be accepted within DATE after the date of opening the inheritance .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , the court may recognise the acceptance of inheritance by an heir who has missed the prescribed time - limit , if it finds the reasons for missing the time - limit to be valid . An heir may accept the inheritance after the expiry of the prescribed time - limit without applying to the courts , if all other heirs who have accepted the inheritance agree . Such agreement signed by the heirs must be notarised . Based on such agreement , the notary shall annul the previous inheritance certificate and issue a new one .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , family members of the deceased , as well as his dependents who are incapacitated , have the right to receive the outstanding salary , pensions , benefits and compensation for damage to life or health which , for whatever reason , were not paid to the deceased in his lifetime . Requests to receive these payments must be submitted within DATE after the date of opening the inheritance . If no such claim is submitted within the prescribed time - limit , the relevant sums shall be included in the estate and be inherited under the general conditions prescribed by this Code .
